habitat_description: Fratercula cirrhata winters on the open ocean (Grinnell and Miller, 1944; Piatt and Kitaysky, 2002). In summer the species can be found nesting on steep, grassy slopes, cliffs, or rock outcrops on undisturbed islands or, occasionally, on the mainland (Grinnell and Miller, 1944; Vermeer, 1979; DeSante and Ainley, 1980; McChesney et al., 1995; Piatt et al., 1997; St. Clair et al., 2001; Piatt and Kitaysky, 2002; Addison et al., 2007), while it forages in open water (Zeiner et al., 1990).
